Lucky Star Cafe Mexican Grill 11 reviews Rating Details Categories: Restaurants Mexican Restaurants American (Traditional) Mexican , American (Traditional) [Edit] 17209 Central Ave Carson , CA 90746 (310) 764-4511 http://www.luckystarcafe.com
Add Photos Hours: Mon-Sat 6 am - 10 pm Good for Kids: Yes Accepts Credit Cards: Yes Parking: Private Lot Attire: Casual Good for Groups: Yes Price Range: $ Takes Reservations: Yes Delivery: No Take-out: Yes Waiter Service: Yes Outdoor Seating: Yes Wi-Fi: Free Good For: Dessert, Lunch, Dinner, Breakfast, Brunch Alcohol: Beer&Wine Only Noise Level: Average Ambience: Divey Has TV: Yes Caters: No Wheelchair Accessible: Yes First to Review jen b. Edit Business Info Send to Friend Bookmark Send to Phone Write a Review Yelp Ad Agaves Kitchen Tequila Naomi B. said: "(1) The wait staff is knowledgeable and they mostly work in concert (meaning, stop any personnel and they will assist you). Trademark of a good leader at the helm. (2)That is a lot of Tequila on the walls, I want a shot of them all!…" read more»
Reviews (11) About This Business
11 reviews for Lucky Star Cafe Mexican Grill Reviews Matching: Search Reviews Sort by: Yelp Sort | Date | Rating | Elites' | Facebook Friends' Facebook Friends
From Reviewers You're Following
Reviews from Your Friends
11 reviews in English
Review from Ronald H.
35 friends 7 reviews
Ronald H.
Los Angeles, CA 2/23/2012 1 photo Another good place to grub! I live by campus and Lucky Star is the first place I think of to grab a breakfast burrito in the morning and any time of the day or night.
I like their El pastor nachos too. They have thin or thick chips and hook it up with a lot of meat.
Lucky Star isn't just all mexican food! Price is affordable and you can get a 10% discount if you're a student.
Was this review…?
Useful Funny Cool

18 friends 100 reviews
Javier L.
Long Beach, CA 4/19/2012 6 Check-ins Here Good food! Try the chicken cabob- really good!
Was this review…?

Review from Kevin P.
Elite '12 497 friends 525 reviews
Kevin P.
Sherman Oaks, CA 10/5/2010 1 Check-in Here it's 6:20a an there's some place else open for breakfast other than Mcdonalds? Sweet.
They have a huge menu, most of it Mexican flair, but for the most part all looking good.
Friendly service at such an early hour, i guess I could say, thank my - "Lucky Star" that this was here and open at such an early hour!
Enjoy, if you're ever down in this neck of the woods.
Listed in: Me Likey Foodie, mmmm Tummy. , Dare to venture south of the…
Was this review…?
Useful (1) Funny Cool
Add owner comment Bookmark Send to a Friend Link to This Review
Review from Squirrel C.
275 friends 408 reviews
Squirrel C.
West Los Angeles, CA 1/9/2008 "You must be my Lucky Star 'Cause you feed me lunch wherever I want I just go to you and get treated right You excel in being a multi-cuisine restaurant And baby you know you don't serve nothing lite"
hmmm, I think I just punched myself in the gut of manhood for using Madonna lyrics to open a review, but what the hell, I'm feeling creative.
Lucky Star is one of those places that almost every LA neighborhood has. It's not entirely Mexican food, although staffed completely by Mexicans and serves the top choices, it's not American food, because of the aforementioned and it's not any of the other half dozen or so different types of cuisines listed on the menu. It's a catch-all spot to go for a Burger and Fries or a Greek Salad washed down with an Horchata! Interestingly enough, they must buy paper cups and napkins from defunct/no longer in SoCal fast food chains, cause you might be lucky to get a Grand Junction Hamburger cup with napkins from Captain D's.
Not a bad choice if you're in the area. And you might even get to catch up on your favorite Tella Novella on one of their many T.V.'s
Was this review…?

Compton, CA 4/13/2011 Great food, huge menu so you have a lot to choose from, and it's resonably priced. Why not go here? Highly recommended

Review from Jenna L.
90 friends 125 reviews
Jenna L.
Los Angeles, CA 2/19/2010 I love this place...it gives me such warm and fuzzies. Such variety and everything I've ordered or tried has just been..sigh...amazing. Stuck on what to get? Try and salad! They've huge! Or try a pastrami burrito or grilled cheese or enchiladas or...I could go on for days but get the idea! And in case anyone's wondering...their catering services are excellent.
Was this review…?
Useful (1) Funny (1) Cool (1)
Add owner comment Bookmark Send to a Friend Link to This Review
Review from Jesus H.
299 friends 144 reviews
Jesus H.
Los Angeles, CA 9/10/2010 2 Check-ins Here This is a pretty good place to get food, but a bit pricey. But they do give large size portions. Most of the times that I have been here it's been a bit crowded. But the food is good. I'm not a seafood lover but my coworkers say their seafood is excellent. There salads are really good like the chicken strip salad is great. They have nice looking waitresses/reps. Check it out.
Was this review…?
Useful Funny Cool
Add owner comment Bookmark Send to a Friend Link to This Review
Review from loren a.
18 friends 66 reviews
loren a.
Bellflower, CA 9/20/2009 Ive gone here and had pancakes, french toast, and a breakfast burrito with bacon and sausage (which i can never finish). I love them all! They have a huge menu. I normally stop by on my way to work. I wouldnt mind trying a burger, but I cant't eat one that early in the morning lol.

Review from Gene B.
2 friends 6 reviews
Gene B.
Carson, CA 6/25/2011 Found this place by accident. It ended up being a really good accident. The food is good and reasonably priced. This is my go to spot when there is no food at home. From the burgers to the breakfast it's all good. My personal favorite is the breakfast burrito. A must have for early morning traffic.

jen b.
Fullerton, CA 8/8/2006 ok. a lottttta food and the price is decent. it's clean and the burritos are huge. what more can you ask for? it is definitely better than the columbia across the street....

Write a Review What's This? About This Business Provided by business Specialties
Lucky star cafe is a fast, healthy and affordable American/Mexican grill establishment that is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner.
Lucky Star cafe is a name with 32 years of tradition behind it. Whats our secret? After one meal at our location, you'll know. Our selections are prepared with only the freshest, highest quality ingredients.
We're also proud to provide you with delicious food&superior service since 1978. Flag as inappropriate View Larger Map/Directions Browse Nearby:
